previous_headings: Chemical data format intro: SMI and SDF/MOL
title: Load, parse, and write chemical data with tidychem
A Grammar for Tidying Chemical Data
text: tidychem package offers lightweight R interface accessing RDKit via RDKit Python API.

title: A Grammar for Tidying Chemical Data
code: library("tidychem") mols <- "smi-multiple.smi" %>% tidychem_example %>% read_smiles  # ECFP4 mols %>% fp_morgan  # similarity # mols %>% fp_morgan %>% sim_tanimoto  # matrix mols %>% fp_morgan(explicit = TRUE) df <- "logd74.tsv" %>% tidychem_example %>% read_tsv y <- df$logD7.4 mols <- df$SMILES %>% parse_smiles mols  # matrix of 2D/3D descriptors x <- mols %>% desc_2d x x[which(is.na(x))] <- 0 library("glmnet")  cvfit = cv.glmnet(x, y) plot(cvfit)  fit <- glmnet(x, y) plot(fit) head(coef(fit, s = cvfit$lambda.min, exact = TRUE), n = 30)

title: Tidy Chemical Data
text: Read, preprocess, featurize chemical data using RDKit. tidychem package offers lightweight R interface accessing RDKit via RDKit Python API.

title: Tidy Chemical Data
text: First , install RDKit. Make sure discoverable reticulate. install tidychem :

title: Tidy Chemical Data
text: already installed Python tidychem, want develop tidychem RStudio, simply create file .Rprofile package directory set Python binary path (Homebrew Python 3 path example ): next time open project, correct Python path library path already set. technical details, see reticulate Python version configuration.

title: Tidy Chemical Data

title: Compute all 2D molecular descriptors — desc_2d
code: if (FALSE) { mol <- parse_smiles("Cc1ccccc1") mols <- read_smiles(tidychem_example("smi-multiple.smi"))  desc_2d(mol) desc_2d(mols)}

title: Compute all 3D molecular descriptors. — desc_3d
text: Since randomization conformer generation process, small numerical differences calculated descriptors different run.

title: Compute all 3D molecular descriptors. — desc_3d
code: if (FALSE) { mol <- parse_smiles("Cc1ccccc1") mols <- read_smiles(tidychem_example("smi-multiple.smi"))  desc_3d(mol) desc_3d(mols)}

title: Compute atom pairs fingerprints — fp_atompair
text: vectorized version fingerprint dimensionality millions, usually considered high direct statistical modeling. Therefore include option return explicit fingerprint matrix .

title: Compute atom pairs fingerprints — fp_atompair
code: if (FALSE) {  mol <- parse_smiles("Cc1ccccc1") mols <- read_smiles(tidychem_example("smi-multiple.smi"))  fp_atompair(mol) fp_atompair(mols) }

Compute MACCS keys as molecular fingerprints — fp_maccs
text: mols tidymol object. explicit Return fingerprints vector matrix? Default FALSE.

title: Compute MACCS keys as molecular fingerprints — fp_maccs
code: if (FALSE) {  mol <- parse_smiles("Cc1ccccc1") mols <- read_smiles(tidychem_example("smi-multiple.smi"))  fp_maccs(mol) fp_maccs(mols)  # get fingerprints matrix fp_maccs(mol, explicit = TRUE) fp_maccs(mols, explicit = TRUE) }

title: Compute Morgan fingerprints (circular fingerprints). — fp_morgan
code: fp_morgan(mols, radius = 2L, use_features = FALSE, explicit = FALSE)

title: Compute Morgan fingerprints (circular fingerprints). — fp_morgan
text: mols tidymol object. radius radius parameter Morgan fingerprints. radius = 2 roughly equivalent ECFP4 FCFP4. use_features use feature-based invariants, similar used FCFP fingerprints? Defaults FALSE. means apply default atom invariants, use connectivity information similar used ECFP fingerprints. explicit Return fingerprints vector matrix? Default FALSE.

title: Compute Morgan fingerprints (circular fingerprints). — fp_morgan
code: if (FALSE) {  mol <- parse_smiles("Cc1ccccc1") mols <- read_smiles(tidychem_example("smi-multiple.smi"))  # ECFP4 fp_morgan(mol) fp_morgan(mols)  # get fingerprints matrix fp_morgan(mol, explicit = TRUE) fp_morgan(mols, explicit = TRUE)  # FCFP2 fp_morgan(mol, radius = 1L, use_features = TRUE) fp_morgan(mols, radius = 1L, use_features = TRUE)  # get fingerprints matrix fp_morgan(mol, radius = 1L, use_features = TRUE, explicit = TRUE) fp_morgan(mols, radius = 1L, use_features = TRUE, explicit = TRUE) }

text: mols tidymol object. explicit Return fingerprints vector matrix? Default FALSE.

title: Compute pattern fingerprints, a topological fingerprint optimized for substructure screening — fp_pattern
code: if (FALSE) {  mol <- parse_smiles("Cc1ccccc1") mols <- read_smiles(tidychem_example("smi-multiple.smi"))  fp_pattern(mol) fp_pattern(mols)  fp_pattern(mol, explicit = TRUE) fp_pattern(mols, explicit = TRUE) }

title: Compute 2D pharmacophore fingerprints. — fp_pharm2d
text: mols tidymol object. type Type fingerprint. "default" uses chemical features defined RDKit, "gobbi" uses set chemical features feature defined Gobbi Poppinger (1998).

title: Compute 2D pharmacophore fingerprints. — fp_pharm2d
code: if (FALSE) {  mol <- parse_smiles("Cc1ccccc1") mols <- read_smiles(tidychem_example("smi-multiple.smi"))  fp_pharm2d(mol) fp_pharm2d(mols)  fp_pharm2d(mol, type = "gobbi") fp_pharm2d(mols, type = "gobbi") }

title: Compute RDKit fingerprints — fp_rdkit
text: Compute Daylight-like fingerprint based hashing molecular subgraphs defined RDKit.

title: Compute RDKit fingerprints — fp_rdkit
text: mols tidymol object. explicit Return fingerprints vector matrix? Default FALSE.

title: Compute RDKit fingerprints — fp_rdkit
code: if (FALSE) {  mol <- parse_smiles("Cc1ccccc1") mols <- read_smiles(tidychem_example("smi-multiple.smi"))  fp_rdkit(mol) fp_rdkit(mols)  # get fingerprints matrix fp_rdkit(mol, explicit = TRUE) fp_rdkit(mols, explicit = TRUE) }

Calculate fingerprint similarity. — sim
code: sim(   fps1 = NULL,   fps2 = NULL,   metric = c("tanimoto", "dice", "cosine", "sokal", "russel", "rogotgoldberg",     "allbit", "kulczynski", "mcconnaughey", "asymmetric", "braunblanquet") )

title: Calculate fingerprint similarity. — sim
text: fps1 tidyfps object. fps2 tidyfps object (optional). metric Metric type.

title: Calculate fingerprint similarity. — sim
code: if (FALSE) {  mols1 <- parse_smiles(c("Cc1ccccc1", "CCN(CC)CC")) mols2 <- parse_smiles(c("Cc1ccccc1", "CCN(CC)CC", "CCC")) fps1 <- fp_maccs(mols1) fps2 <- fp_maccs(mols2)  sim(fps1, metric = "tanimoto") sim(fps1, fps2, metric = "tanimoto")  # or use pipes mols1 %>% fp_maccs %>% sim("tanimoto") (mols1 %>% fp_maccs) %>% sim(mols2 %>% fp_maccs, "tanimoto") }
